official-title.#text:
To amend the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000 relating to determinations with respect to
			 efforts of foreign countries to reduce demand for commercial sex acts
			 under the minimum standards for the elimination of trafficking.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Amendment relating to determinations with respect to efforts of foreign countries to reduce demand
			 for commercial sex acts under the minimum standards for the elimination of
			 trafficking

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding
			 at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 108 of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, if the government of the country has the authority
			 to prohibit the purchase of commercial sex acts and fails to do so, such
			 failure to prohibit the purchase of commercial sex acts shall be deemed to
			 be a failure on the part of the government to make serious and sustained
			 efforts to reduce the demand for commercial sex acts, notwithstanding
			 other efforts made by the government to reduce the demand for commercial
			 sex acts.

header.#text: Criteria with respect to commercial sex acts

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
takes effect on the date of the enactment of this Act and
			 applies with respect to determinations under

that are
			 made on or after such date of enactment.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subsection (b)(12)(A) of
			 section 108 of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4703 IH: To amend the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000 relating to determinations with respect to efforts of foreign countries to reduce demand for commercial sex acts under the minimum standards for the elimination of trafficking.
